title.narrative: Energía Cinco Estrellas, S.A. de C.V.

description.narrative: The Aura Solar II Project (the Project or Aura II) comprises the construction and operation of a 61MWdc (50MWac) greenfield photovoltaic power plant on an area of 150 ha to be located in the Choluteca Municipality, which is approximately 152 km south of the capital city of Tegucigalpa, Honduras. The Project is expected to produce an average of approximately 125GWh per annum. Aura II is being developed by Gauss Energía (Gauss), an independent Mexican energy developer, and will be owned by Corporación Aura Solar (CAS) and by the Flores Family. The Project has successfully secured a 20-year Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with state-owned utility, Empresa Nacional de Energía Eléctrica (ENEE). The PPA is part of a wider effort by ENEE and the Government of Honduras to diversify the countrys electricity supply and improve the reliability of the power grid. Aura II will be constructed and operated under an EPC contract with an experienced engineering firm and PV panels will be supplied by a top-class PV manufacturer. The project is in design stage and construction is expected to be completed by the second half of 2015.

The Project is expected to: (i) provide critical demonstration effect of financial feasibility of one of the first large scale grid-connected solar PV projects in Honduras; (ii) support the diversification of Honduras'' (an IDA country) energy matrix moving away from a fossil fuel based energy generation model; (iii) contribute to the reduction of expensive imports of diesel and bunker, which consequently could help strengthening public finances; (iv) promote climate change agenda, as the project is expected to displace thermal power generation hence reducing carbon emissions; and (v) support the international expansion of an existing Sponsor with renewable energy knowledge into strategic countries for IFC, such as Honduras, setting the base for partnering with them in other projects in the region and enabling a south-to-south investment in the LAC region.

name.narrative: The Project will be located in Choluteca, Honduras on a flat parcel of land across approximately 150 hectares. It will be interconnected to Santa Lucia - an existing substation located in the outskirts of Choluteca - via dedicated 34.5 kV single pole transmission lines with a length of 11 km, along an existing road.
